committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Housing and Community Development

official_title: A bill to provide that social security benefit increases occurring after January 1985 shall not be considered as income or resources for the purposes of determining the eligibility for or amount of assistance which any individual or family is provided under certain Federal housing laws.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Prohibits the consideration of any cost of living or general benefit increase of old age, survivors and disability insurance benefits, after January 1985, for purposes of determining the eligibility for or amount of assistance which any individual or family is provided under the United States Housing Act of 1937, the National Housing Act, the Housing and Urban Development Act of 1965, or the Housing Act of 1949.

titles.title: A bill to provide that social security benefit increases occurring after January 1985 shall not be considered as income or resources for the purposes of determining the eligibility for or amount of assistance which any individual or family is provided under certain Federal housing laws.
